title: Data Structures and Algorithms - Final Exam

questions.question: What is the time complexity of inserting an element into a binary search tree (BST) on average?
Which of the following data structures uses a FIFO (First In, First Out) principle?
What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array?
Which of the following is a self-balancing binary search tree?
What is the worst-case time complexity of QuickSort?
What data structure is used to implement recursion?
Which of the following algorithms is used to find the shortest path in a weighted graph?
What is the best-case time complexity of Merge Sort?
Which of the following data structures provides constant-time access to elements by key?
What is the time complexity of enqueuing an element in a Queue?
Which algorithm is used to traverse a tree in depth-first order?
Which of the following data structures is used for implementing a LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?
Which data structure is best for searching a fixed set of data?
What is the worst-case time complexity for searching an element in a binary search tree (BST)?
Which sorting algorithm is stable and has a worst-case time complexity of O(n^2)?
What is the best-case time complexity of Bubble Sort?
Which of the following is a graph traversal algorithm?
What is the time complexity of searching an element in a Hash Table with good hash function?
Which data structure is used in Prim's Algorithm?
What is the worst-case time complexity of Heap Sort?
What is the time complexity of deleting an element from a linked list?
What is the primary advantage of a doubly linked list over a singly linked list?
questions.correct_answer: Traversal can be done in both directions.

questions.question: Which of the following is a balanced binary search tree?
Which of the following algorithms is NOT a divide and conquer algorithm?
Which sorting algorithm has the best worst-case time complexity?
Which of the following operations has O(1) complexity for a stack?
Which data structure is typically used to implement Dijkstra's algorithm?
What is the space complexity of Merge Sort?
Which of the following is a non-linear data structure?
What is the main difference between a stack and a queue?
questions.correct_answer: A stack is LIFO, while a queue is FIFO.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in a linked list?
What is the key feature of a circular queue?
questions.correct_answer: The rear of the queue is connected to the front.

questions.question: Which data structure is most suitable for implementing a breadth-first search (BFS) algorithm?
Which of the following is true about a max heap?
questions.correct_answer: The parent node is always greater than or equal to its children.

questions.question: Which of the following data structures is most efficient for priority-based scheduling?
What is the time complexity of Heapify operation?
Which algorithm is used for cycle detection in a graph?
Which of the following is a property of B-Trees?
questions.correct_answer: All leaf nodes are at the same level.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of searching for an element in a balanced binary search tree?
Which data structure uses a dynamic array to allow for resizing?
Which algorithm is used to find the minimum spanning tree of a graph?
Which of the following sorting algorithms is NOT in-place?
Which of the following is an advantage of using a linked list over an array?
Which of the following algorithms is typically used for solving the shortest path problem in unweighted graphs?
What is the worst-case time complexity of Bubble Sort?
Which of the following is true about binary heaps?
questions.correct_answer: A binary heap is a complete binary tree.

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is used to detect negative-weight cycles in a graph?
Which of the following data structures is most suitable for implementing an undo feature?
Which of the following is an example of a greedy algorithm?
Which algorithm is used for topological sorting?
